item.title: Best Gifts for Gamers: Our Favorite Accessories, Games and Merch for Consoles and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/best-gifts-for-gamers

It's that time of year when we find ourselves in need of gift ideas. Gift giving comes naturally for some, but for others, finding the perfect gift can be difficult. Thankfully, shopping for someone who enjoys playing video games is pretty straightforward. You can never go wrong getting them a new controller, a pair of headphones, or, well... more games to play.

IGN staff has assembled like the Avengers to provide great gift recommendations for that special gamer in your life. Whether they are fans of Nintendo, PlayStation, Xbox, PC, or just love gaming in general, we've rounded up the absolute best gifts you can find below this holiday season.

Top Gifts for Gamers

Fallout Lucy's Vault 33 Backpack

As seen in Amazon's Fallout TV series, this replica of Lucy's Vault 33 backpack features a yellow fleece blanket, a 16-inch laptop pocket, and nine additional pockets to keep all of your goodies safe from the Wasteland.

If you're shopping for a general gaming-related gift, the IGN Store is home to gifts from just about any fandom. Amazon Prime's Fallout series is hot off the heels of its fantastic first season, and there are plenty of great gifts based on the show including a functional replica of Lucy's Vault 33 backpack, a Vault 33 hoodie, a 3-piece lithograph poster collection, and more. Beyond the Wasteland, however, are many more great gifts like gaming-inspired cookbooks, vinyl record collections, figurines, and much more below.

More top gaming gifts

Still want more ideas? Scroll through the rest of our top video game gifts you haven't explored yet.

Best Gifts for Nintendo Gamers

Shopping for a Nintendo fan shouldn't be too difficult, as they have some of the most recognizable characters and franchises, such as Mario, The Legend of Zelda, and Donkey Kong, which have been around for decades. IGN Technical Producer Amir Rakib recommends the 8Bitdo Ultimate Bluetooth Controller as it's more comfortable for extended gaming sessions than the standard Joy-Con controllers, and he likes the improved Hall Effect sensor joysticks that eliminate stick drift.

8bitdo Ultimate Bluetooth Controller

The 8bitdo Ultimate Controller works with Nintendo Switch, Steam Deck, and PC via Bluetooth or a 2.4GHz wireless connection and features customizable back buttons, built-in rumble, and a charging dock.

Whether you're picking up a new game like Super Mario Jamboree or want to gift a Nintendo-themed toy like the LEGO Super Mario World set that's perfect for a display, we've got plenty of great recommendations for you below.

  • Sonic X Shadow Generations - $29.99

Best Gifts for PlayStation Gamers

There's plenty to pick out for fans of PlayStation, especially those that currently game on a PS5 as there are dozens of great games and accessories to choose from. IGN Commerce Manager Eric Song recommends the PlayStation DualSense Controller, specifically the new Chroma Collection that features iridescent colors that shift from every angle and look great with his RGB setup.

PlayStation DualSense Controller - Chroma Collection

PlayStation's DualSense controller comes in a variety of colors to express yourself and features Adaptive Triggers and Haptic Feedback to immerse you in your gameplay.

If controllers aren't their thing, consider gifting a headset, this year's popular Black Myth: Wukong game, or any of the other recommendations below.

Best Gifts for Xbox Gamers

IGN Executive Editor of Guides and Podcast Unlocked regular Miranda Sanchez recommends the Special Edition Ghost Cipher Xbox Wireless Controller. Why? She thinks it's one of the coolest special edition controllers Xbox has ever released, and loves that you can use it with so many devices outside the Xbox ecosystem, too.

Best Gifts for PC Gamers

If you're looking for the perfect gift for a PC gamer this holiday season, you can't go wrong with picking them up some new peripherals for their rig. While I primarily play with mouse and keyboard, I do recommend having a controller for those times when you want to kick back and relax. I reviewed the Scuf Instinct Pro controller a while back, and it's still one of the best controllers I've ever used. It feels great to hold, doesn't slip while playing thanks to the textured grip, and the adjustable triggers are super snappy.

Scuf Instinct Pro Controller

This pro-grade controller features four mappable rear buttons, a comfortable grip, interchangeable thumbsticks, and instant triggers for faster response time.

Other great gifts below include a small form factor mechanical keyboard, a lightweight mouse, headphones, or some gear for the aspiring streamer in your life.

If you've made it this far and you're still not sure what to get the gamer in your life, you can always rely on a gift card and let them pick out what they want. While you shop around for others or for yourself, be sure to browse early Black Friday gaming discounts as they continue to drop. Black Friday is November 29 this year, but every day we're seeing more deals drop ahead of the big sale's event. For instance, SecretLab has an early deal happening now on Titan Evo gaming chairs, and there will be deals on other chairs (such as the GTRacing one shown below), plus desks, accessories and more.

  • GTRacing Gaming Chair - $93.99

Matthew Adler is a Commerce, Features, Guides, News, Previews, and Reviews writer for IGN. You can follow him on the site formerly known as Twitter @MatthewAdler and watch him stream on Twitch.

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket Is Doing a Fire-type Event, But It's Not Exactly Setting the Community Ablaze
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/pokmon-tcg-pocket-is-doing-a-fire-type-event-but-its-not-exactly-setting-the-community-ablaze

This morning when I woke up I, like every other well-adjusted individual, immediately silenced my alarm and started Pokémon TCG Pocket to open my morning pack. Lo and behold, I discovered that a brand new event had been introduced to the game overnight. It's a "Fire Pokémon Mass Outbreak Event." And it's. Fine.

This fire-type event seemingly came out of nowhere as a pleasant surprise today, and it includes a few different elements. There's a new set of Missions to complete with various rewards, all largely revolving around collecting certain fire-type Pokémon. There are new event-based Wonder Picks, including one that will let you select from five desirable fire-type cards and another that rewards either a fire-type card or currency. And there's a limited-time flair you can purchase for certain cards that gives them a fiery effect. Neat!

As fun as it was to wake up to a surprise event, the reaction from the community so far is... lukewarm, to say the least. This is not the most exciting event! The mission rewards aren't amazing for one, and they require players to complete them with cards obtained during the event. So, for instance, one of the missions is to obtain an Arcanine ex card. I already have one of those. But that doesn't count, because I had it before the event started. So I have to obtain a second one during the event in order to finish the achievement.

Obtaining those cards is supposed to be easier due to the Wonder Pick options, but the hourly free Wonder Pick only has a smaller chance of actually getting a card instead of currency, and the other Wonder Pick that includes five different cards costs a whopping three stamina. For those who don't play Pocket: this means players either need to wait for very long periods of time to get a chance of obtaining the card they want, or they have to spend real money to roll the dice more frequently.

And finally, there's the event flair. It works how all other flairs work - you need to exchange a currency called Shinedust as well as an unusable duplicate of the card you want the flair on to obtain it. That means, for instance, if you want to obtain the event flair for an Arcanine ex, you need not one, not two, but three Arcanine exes sitting around, and then you can exchange the spare one for the flair. Sure, your chances of getting that Arcanine ex are higher thanks to the event Wonder Pick... but, oh, did I mention that the event only lasts five days?

It's admittedly hard to complain here, given that this was a totally unexpected event that really only gives players a few extra chances at some fire-type cards they might want. But in recent days, the Pokémon TCG Pocket community has been getting restless. Community members have been increasingly complaining that there's just not a lot to do after a certain point beyond waiting to open new packs twice a day. Some players are inventing their own battle formats to pass the time, but at the moment, event activities are the main form of entertainment in Pocket. The previous water-type event included a bunch of PvE battles with cards to earn from them, so the fire-type event not including something similar is a bit perplexing.

Ultimately, this seems more like a stopgap between the water-type event and the upcoming expected new booster pack releases. For now, we'll just have to keep opening packs while we wait for something new to happen.

Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. You can find her posting on BlueSky @duckvalentine.bsky.social. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto Community Devastated by GTA 6 Trailer Announcement No-Show After Moon Theory Debunked
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/grand-theft-auto-community-devastated-by-gta-6-trailer-announcement-no-show-after-moon-theory-proved-incorrect

Rockstar was supposed to make a GTA 6 Trailer 2 announcement today, November 22, according to a moon theory that had sent the Grand Theft Auto community into overdrive.

A year on from Rockstar’s internet-breaking GTA 6 Trailer 1 release, information-starved fans have taken to looking at images of the moon as they hunt desperately for clues on Trailer 2.

Why are they doing this? Because the moon theory was proved true for Trailer 1. Two months before Trailer 1 came out, Rockstar released a GTA Online image that included the moon in a phase (Waning Gibbous) that ended up corresponding with the day Rockstar announced the release date of Trailer 1.

99 Details in the GTA 6 Trailer - Slideshow

Fast forward to the start of November 2024, and Rockstar’s release of another GTA Online image, below, that - you guessed it - includes the moon in the Waning Gibbous phase. The real-life moon ends its current Waning Gibbous phase today, November 22, and from tomorrow moves on to the Last Quarter phase. And so, fans thought today would be the last possible day for either Trailer 2 itself or an announcement on when it would drop.

GTA Online Community Update

First details on an exciting new GTA Online update coming in December — featuring clandestine operations launched from the Darnell Bros. Garment Factory.

Plus new community challenges, experience improvements, and more: https://t.co/i1vnYzVtK6 pic.twitter.com/QRn4Bn71Wb

— Rockstar Games (@RockstarGames) November 1, 2024

Unfortunately for its supporters, the moon theory turned out to be wrong this time. 9am Eastern, when Rockstar’s New York-based parent company Take-Two tends to make its announcements, has been and gone without a peep.

The GTA community is struggling to cope with this, taking to social media, Discords, and subreddits to question their world view.

It is remarkable that Rockstar has gone nearly a year without following up GTA 6 Trailer 1 with any new information at all. With GTA 6's fall 2025 release window on PS5 and Xbox Series X and S still on the cards, according to Take-Two, you’d expect Rockstar to pipe up sooner rather than later. But will the moon show fans the way? Or is Rockstar just messing with its fanbase, as it’s done many times in the past?

While you wait to find out, IGN has much more on GTA 6 to check out, including an ex-Rockstar dev who says the studio probably won’t be able to decide whether GTA 6 is delayed until May 2025, the boss of Take-Two's coy response on whether GTA 6 is coming to PC, and the expert opinion on whether the PS5 Pro will run GTA 6 at 60 frames per second.

item.title: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth Drops to Its Lowest Price Ever For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/final-fantasy-vii-rebirth-ps5-black-friday-deal

Save on one of this years best games.

PlayStation's Black Friday sale has kicked off and there's an excellent variety of deals to look through, including on consoles, controllers, and most importantly, games. One of our absolute favorite deals among the latter is on Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, which has gotten a $30 discount in Black Friday sales that's dropped its price from $69.99 to $39.99.

That's 43% off and even marks its lowest price ever according to price tracker camelcamelcamel. As a bonus, this Amazon Exclusive Edition of the game also comes with a PS5 controller skin that features Cloud and Sephiroth. If you've had your eye on it, there's truly no better time to pick up Final Fantasy VII Rebirth for your library.

Final Fantasy VII Rebirth

If you're still on the fence about buying it, it's worth noting that we absolutely adored Final Fantasy VII Rebirth. In our glowing 9/10 review, IGN's Michael Higham said that it, "impressively builds off of what Remake set in motion as both a best-in-class action-RPG full of exciting challenge and depth, and as an awe-inspiring recreation of a world that has meant so much to so many for so long."

Final Fantasy VII Rebirth also recently scored multiple nominations at The Game Awards. Alongside earning a spot in the top category of Game of the Year, it was also nominated for Best Game Direction, Best Narrative, Best Score and Music, Best Audio Design, Best Performance for Briana White, and Best RPG.

This PS5 deal just scratches the surface of what's available right now. More big hits from this year, like Astro Bot and Metaphor: ReFantazio, are also on sale at the moment and there's plenty more deals still to come over the next few days. Have a look at our breakdown of PlayStation's Black Friday sale to learn more about what's available. And for an overall look at this year's sale event, check out our full breakdown of Black Friday 2024.
